tool.name: RNAheat
tool.description: Calculate energies of RNA in a temperature range

param.name: ipoints
param.label: data points to fit parabola to: 2*value+1

param.name: dangling
param.label: how to treat dangling end energies
param.option: 1: unpaired bases participate in one dangling end only
2: unpaired bases participate in all dangling ends

param.name: noconversion
param.label: no conversion
param.help: --noconv do not convert thymine to uracile (T -> U).

param.name: nogu
param.label: No GU pairing
param.help: --noGU don't allow pairing of G and U.

param.name: noclosinggu
param.label: No GU pairing at the ends
param.help: --noClosingGU don't allow pairing of G and U at the ends of helices.

param.name: notetra
param.label: No stabilization for loops, hairpins etc.

tool.help:
**RNAheat**
Calculates the specific heat of RNA sequences in the temperature range t1 to t2, from the partition function by numeric differentiation. The program fits a parabola to 2*ipoints+1 data points to calculate 2nd derivatives. Increasing this parameter produces a smoother curve.
-----
**Input format**
RNAheat requires one input file Fasta format.
------
**Outputs**
The result is written as a list of pairs of temperature in C and specific heat in Kcal/(Mol*K) for each sequence in the input file.
